meanings.definition: of the poorest quality or taste; gaudy or cheap in appearance
meanings.sent1: The tawdriest dress at the party was torn and had bright, mismatched colors.
meanings.sent2: She refused to buy the tawdriest jewelry because it looked fake and poorly made.
meanings.sent3: The tawdriest decorations at the event were so loud and flashy, they hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent4: The tawdriest painting in the gallery seemed to scream for attention with its garish colors.
meanings.sent5: The tawdriest room in the house was filled with tacky furniture and glittery ornaments.

meanings.definition: the least respectable or moral; characterized by low standards or values
meanings.sent1: His tawdriest behavior involved lying and cheating to get what he wanted.
meanings.sent2: The gossip magazine featured the tawdriest stories about celebrities' scandals.
meanings.sent3: The tawdriest character in the play made everyone laugh with their outrageous antics.
meanings.sent4: Her tawdriest thoughts led her down a path of deceit and betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The tawdriest part of the movie was when the villain revealed their evil plan.
